embeds.title: Reprieve
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 2 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

**Ethereal**.
Heal 12 (15) HP.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: I thought this iteration was supposed to be a placeholder
it’s basically just goodstuff
You can get a lot of frontload on hermit to make playing this asap easier
Or discard it with body armor/covet/roulette if needed
we like healing : )
But yeah it’s not crazy busted but all healing prevents chip from killing you and lets you take more fires instead of resting
On the upgrade hungry hermit that’s quite good
this card was nerfed btw!
what was the old effect?
it just heals for less hp now

The current numbers are 10 (13) for reference.

I take it over skipping, and am reasonably happy to see it from building up rare chance after a hallway or elite fight, but would rarely purchase at a shop. Better than skipping at a boss rare card reward, but disappointing. I understand why this has ethereal, but it makes it fairly frustrating to play with. I have found that fairly often, you draw this on a turn where you need to scale or attack, and it’s difficult to justify spending the energy on it (think fights like book of stabbing, triple cultist, reptomancer, giant head). If you draw it on a turn where you need to block, it’s only 5 (6.5) block per energy. You can’t hold onto it with runic pyramid or coalescence, so you have to use it or lose it (there are a handful of ways to discard it, but you'd have to draw them on the same turn). There are off turns, and you can combine it with energy gain or something like snecko eye in order to cast it more easily and get the value. I just find it to be unreliable, and not strong enough to really offset the chip damage from hallway fights. It is your only card that can provide sustain, and you do have cursed weapon that appreciates the healing to offset its life loss. Works well with coffee dripper. Really wants you to have 4 energy or very efficient attack/block cards (misfire, golden bullet, hole up, body armor, etc.) so that you can cast it more easily without taking damage. Fairly weak in act 1 when you don’t have much energy and need to spend it on damage to race in hallway fights, and can often struggle against the very high damage numbers of act 2 as well. Much better for act 3, when you likely have 4 energy and fights are somewhat more forgiving, not to mention the utility of healing at the double boss and during shield and spear. +3 healing on the upgrade is helpful, though it's underwhelming output per energy.

If you look at this next to self repair and reaper, it feels very weak in comparison. It doesn't have the ceiling of reaper, costs just as much, and has ethereal so you can't get setup, then delay fights to wait to cast it near the end. 

Rares have a much higher opportunity cost to take than uncommons like self-repair, it's worse healing per energy, you can't stall out fights to cast it near the end due to ethereal, and you don't have echo form (or for the very patient, creative ai to generate echo form) to double the effect with, nor do you have the power synergies of defect. 

Reprieve just doesn't do anything to stand out, and it definitely does feel like a placeholder (I believe this used to let you exhaust 13 curses to skip the enemies turn or something crazy like that instead). I feel like it should get some kind of buff to make it more appealing as a healing card (currently the poor healing per energy and the ethereal make it feel very weak). This is so middling that it never feels right to take it over the very important/efficient/engine focused rares for hermit (Adapt, Dead or Alive, Dissolve, Eternal Form, Fatal Desire, From Beyond, Overwhelming Power, and sometimes high noon). I'd really only take this if it was offered next to black wind, final canter, purgatory, and roughhouse.
it used to be 1(0) cost exhaust all curses and if this card exhausted at least 13 curses you got an EXTRA TURN
<self repair> for reference

embeds.title: Self Repair
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :blue_energy: / The Defect / Slay the Spire

At the end of combat, heal 7 (10) HP.

messages.content: you can also echo form self repair
so reprieve is a little understatted, IMO.
ya i'm not sure why this was nerfed; 12 health for 2 energy felt fine since since its ethereal so you can't stall to play it on a better turn.
well you can with covet, but generally speaking ethereal on this card balanced it well

in practice since you need to play this card or let it pass. reprieve wont always healing 10 HP since your likely to take some damage when your playing this 2 cost card.  In the worst case scenario this is a 2 cost "block" 10 which is the same value has 2 defends; on a rare card...
so can body armor

Reprieve is pickable to heal of damage from cursed weapon and overwhelming power. Its also an snap pick with snecko eye. otherwise its a bit awkward to get full value out of this card; which is bad since it needs to heal the full amount to be worthwhile. Plus the opportunity cost of taking this over another rare from a boss reward.
healing 12 instead of 10 does not seem like much, but in practice it made a significant difference with how much this card healed over time.

It is worth noting that unlike self repair this card is live during the heart fight. Which is pretty relevant since thats when you need every single hit point the most. The last time I took reprieve was acutally from the act 4 elite.

I think reprieve is very understatted. The nerf to 10 healing makes this like playing 2 basic defends if you are being attacked and need to block that turn. Your other option is to play regular block cards, but in the process lose out on the healing value this card offers due to ethereal. While it is true that this can heal during the heart fight, self-repair can also heal from the shield and spear fight, which it's very possible to stall out with reaper or self repair once you've taken down one of the two enemies. Then you can sit back on frost/focus or barricade and buy time to get max healing. Reprieve is very hard to find a spot to play into shield and spear without losing it to ethereal, and against the heart, you basically have to play it on off turns only, healing 10 (sort of 8 with beat of death) for 2 energy is a miserable deal, and blocking and healing are essentially the same thing at that point since it's the final fight.

Self Repair is bad into bosses, but it can do so much work before you get there that it more than makes up for it. It lets you get more upgrades instead of rests, tops you off at the end of fights, and lets you take much riskier paths with more elites. Being able to heal for 20 at the end of every fights with creative ai or echo form is incredibly strong, especially against shield and spear and the double boss at the end of act 3. I think it's one of defects absolute best cards, you just need to have patience to set it up and remember to double it. Defect often takes significant chip damage when setting up scaling in most hallway and elite fights, but then stabilizes and can stall them out with frost. Being able to use that control over when fights end to heal for 10 or 20 health is so powerful to allow for aggressive pathing and upgrades. The same frost/focus stalling also makes counting relics like happy flower, ink bottle, and incense burner incredible on defect, since you can set them up perfectly for nearly every fight.
How about this idea for Reprieve? 2 (1) Exhaust all Curses in hand, heal 4 HP for each.
Too stally
It has to exhaust for sure
If it has a complicated effect can’t be ethereal
Maybe upgrade to retain?
Not really sure if I’d take 2e retain exhaust all curses in hand, heal 4 hp each, exhaust tho

dumb idea:
do the old effect, but instead of "if this card exhausted 13+ curses", do "if there are 13+ curses in your exhaust pile"

What if it had slightly better numbers, and was templated like called shot? Dead On could desperately use some support at rare.

Reprieve 1
Skill
(Retain.)
Heal 6 HP. If the last card played this turn triggered Dead On, Heal 6 more.
Exhaust.
hmm that's prob a little more viable but you prob only generate like 2-3 at most curses per turn imo
so it's still kinda stally ngl
this is actually an interesting design tbh, it'd prob be decently takeable
depending on your dead on density might not even need upgrade
the issue with this idea is that it is not very thematic with the original idea
the conditional seems very "unreprieve-like", since you have to work hard for it, and it doesn't follow the idea of "lessening a burden" because the conditional requires work

I would say the reprieve represents taking a break and admiring landing a good shot. You're patching up your wounds with the time landing the dead on on bought you? To be honest, I just really want any kind of additional support for Dead On (especially mitigation, a power that gave 1 dexterity/some block every time you landed a card Dead-On would be so helpful to support it). So I'm shoehorning it in here. Also the current iteration of this card just really needs some kind of spice to make it a bit more useful.
You hath invoked the wrath of Carbon
this card isn't bad
y'all gotta stop overdesigning shit
boring =/= bad, rather have 12(15) hp exhaust than keyword soup
it's 10(13) now?
still worth it
healing aint easy to come by, especially not 13 per floor healing
I mean that Kiku was talking about dead on
That’s why I said what I said

Are you really healing though if you're getting attacked on the same turn? It has ethereal (my biggest problem with it) which means that you have to use it or lose it (or hope to draw it alongside covet/body armor/roulette). Upgrading a single use card is not trivial, especially on an upgrade hungry character, and if you happen to draw this on a turn where you are being attacked, it "heals" at the same rate that 2 basic defends would block for.

This card is both boring and bad. It has no particular connection to hermits larger themes, it doesn't have any major synergies, it's effect is very dull. It also happens to have very poor healing per energy when compared with the options available in the base game, has ethereal so you can't wait to cast it until later in a fight, and notably does not have the synergies that those base game cards do either. (reaper+strength gain, and self repair+echo form/storm/heatsinks/force field/amplify).

That's more of a "hermit's kit is wack" than a "this card is bad." Basegame healing options are _all over the place_ for how much they heal for. 1E is worth both 10 and ~4 since Reaper costs 2 but hits AOE, but the ~4 comes from a higher tier, and also 0E can get you 6 from the colorless pool -- and oh God, Potions exist and have some of the wackiest balance in base game.

If you're fucked up about the ethereal that much, hermit DOES have a wack exhaust package. It's definitely his most afterthought set of cards but it can be powerful. 

This card is weak. Yes. _Hermit is weak._
Also, body armor is good enough to take 2 and covet is genuinely my favorite starter card in the mod
remember, this effect was a placeholder
but we all know nothing is more permanent than a placeholder
I agree, i'd rather just see reprieve unnerfed.
12 for 2 feels very fair compared to self repair and bandage up (basically valuing 7 HP as 1 energy and subtracting a little bit of health to compensate getting it right away)
it’s basically a win more card that prevents chip
if you are just underpowered then you need more scaling or frontload

At the end of the day, I'd just like to see something help this card out a bit. It's a rare, and I strongly believe that rares should get to be very good cards, since they primarily serve as rewards for beating challenges. You have to defeat bosses, take on lots of hallway fights to build up rare chance, or build up enough gold (148-181) to buy them from a shop. I would like to either have the numbers bumped back up, or the ethereal removed to make the card more pick able/useable overall. I would also love to see some additional support for Dead On (especially mitigation/defensive options) and this card does have some room to feel less generic.
I just want to see what the un-placeholder effect will be
well as far as the base game goes, this isnt generic at all. Theres nothing like Reprieve in the vanilla game.
reaper
2 cost healing rare that exhausts
this is reaper but spiceless
<bandage up>?

embeds.title: Bandage Up
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :colorless_energy: / Colorless / Slay the Spire

Heal 4 (6) HP.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: further, self repair does the exact same thing but has actual synergies
I was going to crack a joke about from beyond, but then you're using it like a dazed
ethereal makes this card play completely differently then reaper does
reaper you stall out the fight to use, you can't rely on stalling to use reprieve
bandage up you just play no matter what
the point is that the card is bad and is only rare because it heals hp, but it's significantly less efficient than self repair (which has synergies) and reaper (which also has synergies)
the fact that sometimes you don't play it isn't some grand strategic part of the card, it's because it has pitiful numbers attached to it.
ethereal is bad for you of course, but it still changes how the card plays. If its not unique just because it says heal on it then i'm afraid that slay the spire has very few unique cards.

being forced to play it right away has a major impact on if you want to take the card or not. You have to ask, can I afford to play this card right away every time? If I let it exhaust how bad is that? Do I even need to heal 10 right now? what about later? A lot of questions that come up just from one line of text; even if those questions are only being asked because its a negative.
Reprieve would be less interesting if it was not ethereal, although a non ethereal version would be pretty good.
I think it should just be changed back to 12(15), 10(13) just isn't enough.

As for if it's unique enough, out of base game and downfall only like 5 characters even have any way of healing, so just being healing is unique enough, and plus hermit has a razor's edge type "playstyle" that rewards taking damage to some degree. <black wind> <gestalt> and <dented plate> all benefit from being low on health, and having this make you less likely to die while doing that can help.

embeds.title: Black Wind
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 2 (1) :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

**Ethereal**.
Deal damage equal to your missing health.
**Exhaust**.

embeds.title: Gestalt
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 2 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain 2 **Rugged** :p_rugged:.
Gain 2 (1) **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.
**Exhaust**.

embeds.title: Dented Plate
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Hermit / Downfall

While your HP is at or below 50%, gain :energy_hermit:  and draw 1 card at the start of your turn.
*Several bullets are still lodged inside.*

messages.content: Is it the strongest card ever? No. Is it not unique enough that it shouldn't exist? No.

Not every card in the game needs to be really good, some cards just aren't, like <establishment> kinda sucks because retain just isn't worth investing that much into. Doesn't mean it needs a rework or to be removed.

embeds.title: Establishment
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 :purple_energy: / The Watcher / Slay the Spire

 (**Innate**.)
Whenever a card is **Retain**ed, reduce its cost by 1 this combat.

messages.content: establishment is more funny than good
but it lets you do really funny stuff
so it's cool
It's quite powerful with meditate+, and the cost reductions are notably persistent throughout the fight, so it can help lead to some silly infinites by reducing wrath/calm stuff to 0 cost.
